alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 3:13AM CDT until June 02 at 10:35PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Fall River at Fredonia affecting Wilson County. For the Fall River...including Fredonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fall River at Fredonia. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flood waters begin to encroach on residential homes and floods half of yards along the south bank of river located 1 mile south of Fredonia off of Highway 96. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 10.9 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Fall River Fredonia 17.0 26.0 Thu 3 am CDT 7.9 8.3 11.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
